modules.description: This module wraps float values with bounded behavior, applying clamping or conversion to NaN when bounds are exceeded. It operates on private float values and uses an entry function to determine out-of-bound handling. Useful for safely managing performance metrics that must stay within defined ranges.

This module defines a data structure for tracking latency measurements, represented as an optional float, along with an identifier. It includes serialization and deserialization functions to convert between the structure and RPC representations. It is used to record and retrieve latency data in a format compatible with RRDtool for monitoring and visualization.

This module serializes RRD (Round Robin Database) data structures into JSON format. It provides functions to convert data sources, consolidation functions, and round-robin archives into JSON representations suitable for storage or transmission. Use cases include exporting RRD configurations and metrics for external processing or visualization.

This module provides functions for parsing and traversing XML data using the Xmlm library. It includes operations for reading elements, extracting values, and iterating over sequences of XML nodes. Concrete use cases include processing RRD (Round-Robin Database) XML files to extract performance metrics and handling structured XML blocks in performance monitoring contexts.

This module defines a type `t` representing time scales for RRD (Round Robin Database) archives, with operations to create, query, and serialize time scale configurations. It provides functions to calculate time spans for intervals and total coverage, and to convert between JSON and time scale lists. It is used to configure and persist RRD archive settings for time-series data collection.

This module handles the serialization, deserialization, and aggregation of time-series performance data in RRD (Round Robin Database) format. It operates on structured data types like `row` and `t`, which encapsulate timestamps, numeric values, and metadata for exporting or debugging. Concrete use cases include exporting RRD data in XML or JSON formats for monitoring tools, merging multiple RRDs into a unified time-series dataset, and reconstructing RRD updates from serialized strings.

This module handles bounded float operations, array manipulations, and XML parsing for performance monitoring. It works with float values, arrays, lists, and XML data structures. Concrete use cases include safely clamping performance metrics, processing XML from RRD files, and transforming or filtering structured data streams.

This module provides operations for managing time-series data storage with support for data sources, consolidation functions (average, min, max, last), and round robin archives. It works with structured types representing RRD components, including typed data sources, time-based value rings, and consolidated data points, while handling arithmetic operations, unknown value propagation, and serialization to XML/JSON. Key use cases include recording metrics with variable sampling frequencies, maintaining historical data aggregates, and integrating with latency tracking systems through state file hooks.

This module implements a fixed-size ring buffer for floating-point values, bounded to a specified range. It supports operations like pushing new values, retrieving historical elements by index, iterating over elements, and extracting arrays of recent or all stored values. It is used to maintain rolling windows of numeric data, such as in time-series analysis or performance metrics tracking.

This module offers a function `to_fd` that serializes an RRD to XML or JSON and writes it to a file descriptor. It operates on RRD data structures and interacts directly with Unix file descriptors. A typical use case involves exporting RRD data to a socket or file for external consumption.
